intro: Barkeria naevosa, commonly known as the spotted rock cress, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers and basal leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating. Barkeria naevosa typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It is often found in mountainous regions and is known for its resilience to harsh climatic conditions.
